sentences.sContent: They are putting pressure on people to vote yes.
sentences.sCn: 他们正在向民众施加压力，要求他们投赞成票。

sentences.sContent: You must never give in to pressure .
...other factors are putting downward pressure on oil prices: change in the strategies behavior of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries...
...more people will be looking for jobs and the pressure on employers to raise wages to attract workers will decline...
...strongly suggest that there will be a great pressure on wages in the future as more people will be unemployed...
...Without sustained external pressure it seems certain Mr...
...But that isn’t why the government—under pressure from cancer charities...
...workplace norms and expectations that pressure them to overwork often prevent them from taking it...
...the demand for resources in an energy-hungry world could raise pressure to renegotiate Antarctica’s treaties...
...or you can approach alongside and slowly apply pressure to gradually alter his course...
...and a lot of pressure and responsibility to think about how we urbanize...

phrases.pCn: 面临压力，在压力之下；受到压力
气压；气体压力；煤气压力
压力差；差压；压力补偿器；气压梯度

remMethod.val: press(压) ＋ ure(表行为) → 对…施加压力

words.tran: 加压的；有使血压增高的；收缩血管的
压；按；新闻；出版社；[印刷] 印刷机
增压；密封；使…加压（pressurize的过去式）
密封；增压；使……加压，使……压入

trans.tranOther: an attempt to persuade someone by using influence, arguments, or threats

trans.tranCn: 对…施加压力， 迫使， 说服
trans.tranOther: to try to make someone do something by making them feel it is their duty to do it
